alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:48PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Arapahoe, southwestern Washington and southeastern Adams Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 347 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Shamrock, or 33 miles south of Fort Morgan, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodlin School, Cottonwood Valley, Lindon, Shamrock and Last Chance. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Washington County
